title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential.

You can work remotely or join one of our offices, which are located in Warsaw, Krakow, Katowice, Wroclaw and Gdansk.

The remote option applies only to the Candidates who will be working from any location in Poland.

DESCRIPTION
This job is about turning data into actionable knowledge, which requires a blend of scientific, problem solving, analytical, technical, and communication skills. The role is... primarily focused on (but not limited to) solving business problems in technological domain of Data Science.
Responsibilities
• Identify business problems, find the right data and methods to address them
• Process large volumes of structured and unstructured customer data using advanced analytical solutions Turn analysed data into unique actionable insights and business value
• Create high-quality data visualizations
• Create data pipelines for feature engineering, missing values treatment, outliers' detection, etc
• Perform research, build, and validate analytical, mathematical, econometric, descriptive, and predictive models that deliver better decisions across a broad range of industries and data sources
• Estimate, plan and coordinate the delivery of moderate/large sized projects
• Evaluate and select the best matching Data Science tools and libraries
• Present findings in a clear and informative way
• Communicate effectively with different departments and roles (stakeholders, product managers, engineers) to discuss complex data-driven findings and technical matters
• Continuously develop knowledge base within the Data Scientists team, participate in common brainstorming sessions
• Educate junior and middle Data Scientists
Requirements
• 3+ years of relevant experience working with a variety of information systems and data
• Writing high-quality Python code according to PEP-8 guidelines
• Strong knowledge of various data exploration and analysis techniques, ability to build models or analytical frameworks, develop hypotheses, and design experiments
• Advanced knowledge in one of the domains: Computer Vision, Time Series, Natural Language Processing, Recommendation systems, Predictive Analytics
• Knowledge of EDA, classical vs advanced Machine Learning models, model performance metrics and losses, model finetuning
• Knowledge of pros&cons for SOTA ML architectures and applicable use cases for them
• Understanding of ML projects' life cycle and ability to follow methodology processes (CRISP-DM, TDSP, LeanDS, etc.) used in data science projects
• Ability to design and supervise data labelling process
• Ability to interpret and report results of analyses, provide business recommendations; ability to coach and train others
Nice to have
• Strong academic background, Bachelor's / Master's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Applied Statistics, or a related field
• Machine Learning Engineering mindset, experience with Docker, Linux, CI/CD, MLFlow, etc
• Projects completed using different methodology/models or knowledge of one of the Deep Learning frameworks (PyTorch, Tensorflow)
• Experience with ML services of cloud providers: AWS, Azure, or GCP
• Experience with PySpark
• Some experience in ML project technical leadership
We offer
• Team & working conditions:
• Friendly team and enjoyable working environment
• Engineering community of industry's professionals
• Flexible schedule and opportunity to work remotely
• Relocation within our offices
• Corporate and social events
• Benefits package (health insurance, multisport, shopping vouchers)
• Stable income:
• Employment Contract or B2B
• Regular assessments and salary reviews
• Participation in the Employee Stock Purchase Plan
• Referral bonuses
• Career development:
• Innovative solutions delivery and engineering excellence
• Outstanding career roadmap
• Leadership development, career advising, soft skills and well-being programs
• Certification (GCP, Azure, AWS)
• Unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning, Get Abstract, O'Reilly, Cloud Guru

title: Data Scientist
description:
Data Scientist (m/f/d)

As the Data Science Hub Europe in Nestle, we continuously search for new talents to join our international team dedicated to delivering efficient and high-quality data solutions. In your role of a Data Scientist, you will collaborate with fellow Data Scientists , Analysts and Engineers to drive innovation and develop top-notch analytical models and methods. Your skill, competence and creativity will directly support and impact critical business decisions in areas of supply chain and marketing.

In this role you will:
• Actively participate in each stage of the data science lifecycle, from business understanding through model development to industrialization
• Design, build and maintain statistical/machine learning models to optimize business operations
• Explore and experiment with innovative ML techniques and approaches to maximize value generated by the team
• Be a thought leader in development of methodology within big scale transformational projects
•... Communicate model & analysis results to a non-technical audience that includes stakeholders and senior management, and win their buy-in
• Coach and mentor other team members on multiple aspects of a data scientist role

You are the right candidate if you bring along:
• 2+ years of professional experience building and industrializing machine learning solutions
• Proficiency in at least one language employed in ML & statistical analysis (Python or R preferred) and its use with version control (git) and testing
• Practical knowledge of SQL
• Experience in application of ML concepts and methodologies (regression and classification, time series modeling, feature engineering and selection, regularization etc.)
• Solid knowledge of ML techniques and algorithms (incl. various regression types, ensembles, clustering, decision trees, boosting, etc.) and their pros and cons
• Ability to reframe business challenges into data science problems and adjust ML methods & tools accordingly
• Good communication and presentation skills, in particular facilitation of grasping complex topics by broad audiences, incl. non-technical stakeholders
• Track record of effective collaboration with IT / data engineering teams in development and production phase

You will draw even more of our attention if you have:
• Databricks & PySpark expertise
• Broad familiarity with visualization tools (Power BI, R Shiny, etc.) and solutions based on them
• Experience in leading cross-functional and/or international projects
• Interest in codifying and disseminating knowledge & best practices, incl. documentation of projects

In return we offer:
• Exciting work in a multi-cultural team of bright minds – data lovers and practitioners
• Flexible remote work options, or – if your prefer – access to a modern office in Warsaw’s Mokotów, walking distance from Metro Wilanowska
• Internal training programs and access to external knowledge resources aimed at expanding your skills and competence
• Support in building your ML skills and portfolio through participation and presenting at conferences and events
• Opportunities to develop further in our Data Science Hub as well as in the international organization
• Option of full-time contract
• All kinds of juicy fringe benefits: private medical care, pension fund, cafeteria program, Multisport card, co-financing of meals in the company's canteen, discounts for Nestle products

Risk Analytics forms the backbone of our business. As Data Analyst - Risk, you will be responsible for providing analytics not only to our tribe but also to the Risk Platform’s customers across the entire organisation. Using your proven track record of success in a similar environment, together with your team you will build a roadmap and strategy, setting a vision for the Risk Analytics function at Sumup and drive execution according to this vision.

In the role of Data Analyst - Risk you will be analyzing structured data (risk, transaction risk, account security, form models, account take over) and use the outcome of this analysis to advise the business, supporting Data Scientists and Product Teams by creating model-based decision strategies to generate “bottom-line”... business benefits through the optimization of product offers and related experiences across all platforms.

Your objective lies in making sure that the rest of the company is well informed and able to use Risk data to generate actionable insights empowering our business partners to produce optimal customer experiences through innovations in data-driven decision making.

What you’ll do:
• Contribute to building data insights to help the team take the right decision, enabling good and stopping bad in all our checkpoints
• Support planning and prioritization processes by providing data driven value estimation of competing initiatives
• Suggest and be able to take decisions on how to find and obtain the required data
• Building dashboard with key KPIs, metrics and performance indicators
• Liaise between Product, Business and Data Science teams to ensure that business requirements are understood and prioritised
• Provide thought leadership on how we present data and how we can improve

You’ll be great for this role if you have:
• Minimum 3+ years of experience in analytics, with at least 2 of those years in product or product-adjacent analytics
• Experience in the risk domain would be beneficial
• Payment industry experience (highly desired)
• Clear and efficient communication, coupled with evident enthusiasm for leading a team and helping people grow
• Ability to operate on a cross organsational level with multiple business and technical stakeholders
• Demonstration of advanced SQL ability; Python or R knowledge is a plus
• Experience building dashboards using tools such as PowerBI, Tableau or similar

• Help build a world class risk platform using the latest technologies and industry practices
• You will be part of a global analytics community, with opportunities for collaboration, knowledge sharing, and ongoing training & development.
